EXISTING STRUCTURES
────────────────────────
### Resource Depot & Smelting Facility at base position (x=-4.5, y=18.5)
Consists of:
• Wooden Chest at (x=-4.5, y=18.5) serving as central storage.
• Stone Furnace at (x=-3.0, y=19.0) for iron smelting (recently received an additional iron ore to address ingredient shortage).
• Stone Furnace at (x=-4.0, y=21.0) for copper plate production.
• Burner Inserter at (x=0.5, y=21.5) with drop at (x=0.5, y=20.5).

### Automation Lab & Steam Power System (Integrated System) at base configuration
Consists of:
• Lab at (x=-7.5, y=18.5) dedicated to automation research.
• Boiler at (x=-5.5, y=24.0) supplying thermal energy (refueled with 10 coal, though still flagged NO_FUEL).
• Steam Engine at (x=6.5, y=34.5) repositioned from (x=-0.5, y=24.5) for power output but currently not connected.
• Offshore Pump at (x=-7.5, y=25.5) supporting fluid intake.
• Electricity Group with small electric poles at (x=-0.5, y=11.5), (x=-7.5, y=15.5), (x=-4.5, y=15.5), (x=3.5, y=19.5) and (x=1.5, y=22.5).
• Dual PipeGroups forming the fluid network at (x=-10.5, y=16.5) & (x=-12.5, y=18.5) and at (x=-8.5, y=20.5) & (x=-2.5, y=21.5).

### Copper Cable Factory at position (x=1.5, y=19.5)
Consists of:
• Assembling Machine at (x=1.5, y=19.5) running the copper‑cable recipe (recently received 1 copper plate yet remains unpowered).
• Burner Inserter at (x=1.5, y=17.5).
• Input Chest at (x=2.5, y=17.5) for copper plates.
• Output Chest at (x=1.5, y=21.5) dispatching copper cable.
• Dedicated Copper Buffer Chest at (x=-5.5, y=21.5).
• Dedicated Transport Belt Segment at (x=0.5, y=17.5) linking outputs.
• Additional Burner Inserters at (x=2.5, y=16.5) and (x=3.5, y=17.5).

### Copper Extraction System (adjacent to the copper smelting furnace)
Consists of:
• Extraction Burner Inserter at (x=-3.5, y=23.5) with pickup at (x=-3.5, y=22.5) and drop at (x=-3.5, y=24.5).
• Copper Buffer Chest at (x=-3.5, y=26.5).
• Chest Extraction Burner Inserter at (x=-3.5, y=27.5) with pickup at (x=-3.5, y=26.5) and drop at (x=-3.5, y=28.5).
• Belt Source Inserter at (x=-3.5, y=25.5).

### Extraction Belt Depot at position (x=3.5, y=15.5)
Consists of:
• Wooden Chest at (x=3.5, y=15.5) serving as the belt depot.
• Dedicated Transport Belt Segment at (x=4.5, y=15.5) for copper plate conveyance.
• Depot Burner Inserter at (x=3.5, y=14.5) with pickup at (x=3.5, y=15.5) and drop at (x=3.5, y=13.5).

### Belt Connection Target Setup for Copper Extraction
Consists of:
• Extraction Source: Wooden Chest at (x=3.5, y=15.5).
• Extraction Inserter at (x=4.5, y=15.5) with pickup at (x=3.5, y=15.5) and drop at (x=5.5, y=15.5).
• Manual Transport Belt Chain comprising:
 – Horizontal segments at (x=7.5, y=15.5) and (x=8.5, y=15.5) (note: blocked placement at (x=6.5, y=15.5)).
 – Vertical segments at (x=8.5, y=14.5), (x=8.5, y=13.5), (x=8.5, y=12.5) and (x=8.5, y=11.5) (note: occupancy error at (x=8.5, y=10.5)).
• New Target Inserter at (x=8.5, y=9.5) with pickup at (x=8.5, y=10.5) and drop at (x=8.5, y=8.5).
• Belt Chain Burner Inserter Refueling Subsystem with:
 – Burner Inserters at (x=6.5, y=9.5), (x=7.5, y=9.5) and (x=8.5, y=9.5) operating with reduced fuel levels (≈6 units).
 – Additional Burner Inserters at (x=3.5, y=14.5) and (x=5.5, y=14.5).

ERROR TIPS
────────────────────────
• RESOURCE AND POWER SUPPLY:
 – Furnaces (e.g., at (x=-3.0, y=19.0)) continue to face ingredient shortages despite targeted insertions; ensure a steady and sufficient supply of raw materials.
 – The Assembling Machine in the Copper Cable Factory remains unpowered after resource corrections; verify and reinforce electrical connectivity.
 – The Boiler, although recently refueled, is still flagged as NO_FUEL; monitor refuel dispatches to maintain uninterrupted operation.
 – The Lab continues to exhibit power deficits; review overall power distribution to stabilize core modules.

• STEAM ENGINE CONNECTION:
 – Both the original Steam Engine (from (x=-0.5, y=24.5)) and the repositioned unit at (x=6.5, y=34.5) have failed to establish valid fluid connections with the Boiler at (x=-5.5, y=24.0). Ensure that all connection points are clear of obstructions and properly aligned to permit fluid transfer.

• BURNER INSERTER FUEL MANAGEMENT:
 – Repeated low fuel and “out of fuel” warnings across multiple burner inserters necessitate a review of the fuel distribution network, ensuring fuel is readily accessible.

• TILE PLACEMENT & OCCUPANCY:
 – Persistent issues with blocked placement (e.g., at (x=6.5, y=15.5)) and occupancy errors (e.g., at (x=8.5, y=10.5)) call for pre-placement verification of tile availability and removal of obstructions.

• GLOBAL SYSTEM CONFIGURATION:
 – Although peripheral auto‑optimization has resolved transient anomalies, central challenges in power distribution and resource delivery persist. Prioritize alignment and integration of core system configurations.
